017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020
021import java.util.AbstractSet;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.Iterator;
025import java.util.Set;
026import java.util.SortedSet;
027import java.util.Spliterator;
028import java.util.TreeSet;
029
030/**
031 * An {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable}
032 * {@link AbstractSet} of {@link Type}s with additional convenient
033 * functionality.
034 *
035 * <p>{@linkplain #iterator() Iteration} over any {@link TypeSet}
036 * instance is guaranteed to be in some deterministic but otherwise
037 * unspecified order.  The order is subject to change between versions
038 * of this class.</p>
039 *
040 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
041 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
042 */
043public class TypeSet extends AbstractSet<Type> {
044
045
046  /*
047   * Instance fields.
048   */
049
050
051  private final SortedSet<Type> typeSet;
052
053  private volatile SortedSet<Class<?>> classes;
054
055  private volatile SortedSet<Class<?>> interfaces;
056
057  private volatile SortedSet<Class<?>> rawTypes;
058
059  private volatile Class<?> mostSpecializedInterface;
060
061  private volatile Class<?> mostSpecializedClass;
062
063
064  /*
065   * Constructors.
066   */
067
068
069  /**
070   * Creates a forever-{@linkplain #isEmpty() empty} {@link TypeSet}.
071   */
072  public TypeSet() {
073    this(Collections.emptySet());
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * Creates a {@link TypeSet} that {@linkplain #contains(Object)
078   * contains} only the supplied {@link Type} unless the supplied
079   * {@link Type} is {@code null}, in which case the resulting {@link
080   * TypeSet} will be forever {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty}.
081   *
082   * @param type the {@link Type} the new {@link TypeSet} will
083   * contain; may be {@code null} in which case the new {@link
084   * TypeSet} will be {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty}
085   */
086  public TypeSet(final Type type) {
087    this(type == null ? Collections.emptySet() : Collections.singleton(type));
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * Creates a {@link TypeSet} that {@linkplain #contains(Object)
092   * contains} only the {@link Type}s supplied unless the supplied
093   * {@link Collection} is {@code null} or {@linkplain
094   * Collection#isEmpty() empty}, in which case the resulting {@link
095   * TypeSet} will be forever {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty}.
096   *
097   * @param types the {@link Type}s the new {@link TypeSet} will
098   * contain; may be {@code null} or {@linkplain Collection#isEmpty()
099   * empty} in which case the new {@link TypeSet} will be forever
100   * {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty}
101   */
102  public TypeSet(final Collection<? extends Type> types) {
103    super();
104    if (types == null || types.isEmpty()) {
105      this.typeSet = Collections.emptySortedSet();
106    } else {
107      final SortedSet<Type> sortedTypeSet = new TreeSet<>(Types.typeNameComparator);
108      sortedTypeSet.addAll(types);
109      this.typeSet = Collections.unmodifiableSortedSet(sortedTypeSet);
110    }
111  }
112
113
114  /*
115   * Instance methods.
116   */
117
118
119  /**
120   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
121   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link SortedSet}
122   * of all raw types contained directly or indirectly by this {@link
123   * TypeSet}.
124   *
125   * <p>This method calls the {@link #getClasses()} and {@link
126   * #getInterfaces()} methods as part of its operation.</p>
127   *
128   * @return a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
129   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link SortedSet}
130   * of all raw types contained directly or indirectly by this {@link
131   * TypeSet}
132   *
133   * @see #getClasses()
134   *
135   * @see #getInterfaces()
136   *
137   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
138   *
139   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
140   * threads.
141   *
142   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.  The
143   * {@link Set} that is returned consists of elements in a
144   * particular, but deliberately unspecified, order that is not
145   * dependent upon the ordering of the {@link Set} of {@link Type}s
146   * initially supplied to this {@link TypeSet}.
147   */
148  public final SortedSet<Class<?>> getRawTypes() {
149    SortedSet<Class<?>> rawTypes = this.rawTypes;
150    if (rawTypes == null) {
151      final SortedSet<Class<?>> classes = this.getClasses();
152      final SortedSet<Class<?>> interfaces = this.getInterfaces();
153      if (classes.isEmpty()) {
154        if (interfaces.isEmpty()) {
155          rawTypes = Collections.emptySortedSet();
156        } else {
157          rawTypes = interfaces;
158        }
159      } else if (interfaces.isEmpty()) {
160        rawTypes = classes;
161      } else {
162        final SortedSet<Class<?>> target = new TreeSet<>(Types.typeNameComparator);
163        target.addAll(classes);
164        target.addAll(interfaces);
165        rawTypes = Collections.unmodifiableSortedSet(target);
166      }
167      this.rawTypes = rawTypes;
168    }
169    return rawTypes;
170  }
171
172  /**
173   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
174   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link SortedSet}
175   * of all {@link Class}es (not interfaces) contained directly or
176   * indirectly by this {@link TypeSet}.
177   *
178   * @return a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
179   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link Set} of all
180   * {@link Class}es (not interfaces) contained directly or indirectly
181   * by this {@link TypeSet}
182   *
183   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
184   *
185   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
186   * threads.
187   *
188   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.  The
189   * {@link Set} that is returned consists of elements in a
190   * particular, but deliberately unspecified, order that is not
191   * dependent upon the ordering of the {@link Set} of {@link Type}s
192   * initially supplied to this {@link TypeSet}.
193   */
194  public final SortedSet<Class<?>> getClasses() {
195    SortedSet<Class<?>> classes = this.classes;
196    if (classes == null) {
197      if (this.isEmpty()) {
198        classes = Collections.emptySortedSet();
199      } else {
200        classes = new TreeSet<>(Types.typeNameComparator);
201        for (final Type type : this) {
202          Class<?> rawType = Types.toRawType(type);
203          while (rawType != null) {
204            if (!rawType.isInterface()) {
205              classes.add(rawType);
206            }
207            rawType = rawType.getSuperclass();
208          }
209        }
210        if (classes.isEmpty()) {
211          classes = Collections.emptySortedSet();
212        } else {
213          classes = Collections.unmodifiableSortedSet(classes);
214        }
215      }
216      assert classes != null;
217      this.classes = classes;
218    }
219    return classes;
220  }
221
222  /**
223   * Returns a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
224   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link Set} of all
225   * interfaces contained directly or indirectly by this {@link
226   * TypeSet}.
227   *
228   * @return a non-{@code null}, {@linkplain
229   * Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set) unmodifiable} {@link Set} of all
230   * interfaces contained directly or indirectly by this {@link
231   * TypeSet}
232   *
233   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
234   *
235   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
236   * threads.
237   *
238   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.  The
239   * {@link Set} that is returned consists of elements in a
240   * particular, but deliberately unspecified, order that is not
241   * dependent upon the ordering of the {@link Set} of {@link Type}s
242   * initially supplied to this {@link TypeSet}.
243   */
244  public final SortedSet<Class<?>> getInterfaces() {
245    SortedSet<Class<?>> interfaces = this.interfaces;
246    if (interfaces == null) {
247      if (this.isEmpty()) {
248        interfaces = Collections.emptySortedSet();
249      } else {
250        interfaces = new TreeSet<>(Types.typeNameComparator);
251        for (final Type type : this) {
252          TypeSet.getInterfaces(type, interfaces); // adds to interfaces
253        }
254        if (interfaces.isEmpty()) {
255          interfaces = Collections.emptySortedSet();
256        } else {
257          interfaces = Collections.unmodifiableSortedSet(interfaces);
258        }
259      }
260      this.interfaces = interfaces;
261    }
262    return interfaces;
263  }
264
265  /**
266   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Class} that is guaranteed
267   * to be the most specialized interface in its type hierarchy drawn
268   * from the {@linkplain #getInterfaces() interfaces} in this {@link
269   * TypeSet}, or {@code null} if this {@link TypeSet} contains no
270   * interfaces.
271   *
272   * <p>The {@link Class} that is returned is guaranteed to return
273   * {@code true} from its {@link Class#isInterface()} method.</p>
274   *
275   * <p>For example, if a {@link TypeSet} contains {@link
276   * java.io.Closeable Closeable.class} and {@link AutoCloseable
277   * AutoCloseable.class}, then this method will return {@link
278   * java.io.Closeable Closeable.class}.  If a {@link TypeSet}
279   * contains {@link AutoCloseable AutoCloseable.class} and {@link
280   * java.io.Serializable Serializable.class}, then either {@link
281   * AutoCloseable AutoCloseable.class} or {@link java.io.Serializable
282   * Serializable.class} will be returned.</p>
283   *
284   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Class} that is guaranteed
285   * to be the most specialized interface in its type hierarchy drawn
286   * from the {@linkplain #getInterfaces() interfaces} in this {@link
287   * TypeSet}, or {@code null}
288   *
289   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
290   *
291   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
292   *
293   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
294   * threads.
295   *
296   * @see #getMostSpecializedClass()
297   */
298  public final Class<?> getMostSpecializedInterface() {
299    final Class<?> mostSpecializedInterface = this.mostSpecializedInterface;
300    final Class<?> returnValue;
301    if (mostSpecializedInterface == null) {
302      final Set<Class<?>> interfaces = this.getInterfaces();
303      if (interfaces == null || interfaces.isEmpty()) {
304        this.mostSpecializedInterface = Object.class; // marker
305        returnValue = null;
306      } else {
307        final Iterator<? extends Class<?>> interfacesIterator = interfaces.iterator();
308        Class<?> candidate = interfacesIterator.next();
309        while (interfacesIterator.hasNext()) {
310          Class<?> intrface = interfacesIterator.next();
311          if (candidate.isAssignableFrom(intrface)) {
312            candidate = intrface;
313          }
314        }
315        this.mostSpecializedInterface = returnValue = candidate;
316      }
317    } else if (mostSpecializedInterface.equals(Object.class)) {
318      // marker
319      returnValue = null;
320    } else {
321      returnValue = mostSpecializedInterface;
322    }
323    return returnValue;
324  }
325
326  /**
327   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Class} that is guaranteed
328   * to be the most specialized subclass in its type hierarchy drawn
329   * from the {@linkplain #getClasses() classes} in this {@link
330   * TypeSet}.
331   *
332   * <p>For example, if a {@link TypeSet} contains {@link Integer
333   * Integer.class}, {@link Number Number.class} and {@link Object
334   * Object.class}, then this method will return {@link Integer
335   * Integer.class}.  If a {@link TypeSet} contains {@link Integer
336   * Integer.class} and {@link String String.class}, then either
337   * {@link Integer Integer.class} or {@link String String.class} will
338   * be returned.</p>
339   *
340   * <p>In practice, most {@link TypeSet}s in normal use contain
341   * classes from a single inheritance hierarchy.</p>
342   *
343   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Class} that is guaranteed
344   * to be the most specialized subclass in its type hierarchy drawn
345   * from the {@linkplain #getClasses() classes} in this {@link
346   * TypeSet}; never {@code null}
347   *
348   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
349   *
350   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
351   *
352   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
353   * threads.
354   *
355   * @see #getMostSpecializedInterface()
356   */
357  public final Class<?> getMostSpecializedClass() {
358    final Class<?> mostSpecializedClass = this.mostSpecializedClass;
359    final Class<?> returnValue;
360    if (mostSpecializedClass == null) {
361      final Set<Class<?>> classes = this.getClasses();
362      if (classes == null || classes.isEmpty()) {
363        this.mostSpecializedClass = returnValue = Object.class;
364      } else {
365        final Iterator<? extends Class<?>> classesIterator = classes.iterator();
366        assert classesIterator.hasNext();
367        Class<?> candidateClass = classesIterator.next();
368        assert candidateClass != null;
369        assert !candidateClass.isInterface();
370        while (classesIterator.hasNext()) {
371          final Class<?> cls = classesIterator.next();
372          assert cls != null;
373          assert !cls.isInterface();
374          if (candidateClass.isAssignableFrom(cls)) {
375            candidateClass = cls;
376          }
377        }
378        this.mostSpecializedClass = returnValue = candidateClass;
379      }
380    } else {
381      returnValue = mostSpecializedClass;
382    }
383    assert returnValue != null;
384    return returnValue;
385  }
386
387  /**
388   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
389   *
390   * @param type ignored
391   *
392   * @return Not applicable
393   *
394   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
395   */
396  @Override
397  public final boolean add(final Type type) {
398    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
399  }
400
401  /**
402   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
403   *
404   * @param types ignored
405   *
406   * @return Not applicable
407   *
408   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
409   */
410  @Override
411  public final boolean addAll(final Collection<? extends Type> types) {
412    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
413  }
414
415  /**
416   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
417   *
418   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
419   */
420  @Override
421  public final void clear() {
422    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
423  }
424
425  @Override
426  public final boolean contains(final Object object) {
427    return !this.isEmpty() && this.typeSet.contains(object);
428  }
429
430  @Override
431  public final boolean containsAll(final Collection<?> objects) {
432    return !this.isEmpty() && this.typeSet.containsAll(objects);
433  }
434
435  @Override
436  public final boolean isEmpty() {
437    return this.typeSet.isEmpty();
438  }
439
440  @Override
441  public final Iterator<Type> iterator() {
442    return this.typeSet.iterator();
443  }
444
445  /**
446   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
447   *
448   * @param object ignored
449   *
450   * @return Not applicable
451   *
452   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
453   */
454  @Override
455  public boolean remove(final Object object) {
456    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
457  }
458
459  /**
460   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
461   *
462   * @param objects ignored
463   *
464   * @return Not applicable
465   *
466   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
467   */
468  @Override
469  public boolean removeAll(final Collection<?> objects) {
470    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
471  }
472
473  /**
474   * Throws an {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when invoked.
475   *
476   * @param objects ignored
477   *
478   * @return Not applicable
479   *
480   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException when invoked
481   */  
482  @Override
483  public boolean retainAll(final Collection<?> objects) {
484    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
485  }
486
487  @Override
488  public final int size() {
489    return this.typeSet.size();
490  }
491
492  @Override
493  public final Spliterator<Type> spliterator() {
494    return this.typeSet.spliterator();
495  }
496
497  @Override
498  public final Object[] toArray() {
499    return this.typeSet.toArray();
500  }
501
502  @Override
503  public final <T> T[] toArray(final T[] array) {
504    return this.typeSet.toArray(array);
505  }
506
507  @Override
508  public String toString() {
509    return this.typeSet.toString();
510  }
511
512
513  /*
514   * Static methods.
515   */
516
517
518  private static final void getInterfaces(final Type type, final Set<Class<?>> interfaces) {
519    Class<?> cls = Types.toRawType(type);
520    if (cls.isInterface()) {
521      interfaces.add(cls);
522    }
523    while (cls != null) {
524      for (final Class<?> intrface : cls.getInterfaces()) {
525        if (interfaces.add(intrface)) {
526          TypeSet.getInterfaces(intrface, interfaces); // XXX recursive
527        }
528      }
529      cls = cls.getSuperclass();
530    }
531  }
532
533}
